data.message: I got something else to say here ... I think there is an omen of some kind in the timing of the making of this movie . From what I heard the movie was metaphorically based on M's life before and after the near death experience. M was also supposed to be the lead actor in Southpaw , But due to the MMLP2 album been woven and released M couldn't make it for the lead role that Jake then played . I find the timing so synconistic In the sense that "MMLP2 "was the actual rebirth of M , "relapse " was more of a traversing between worlds or should I say a coming up out the underworld ...anyway what Im tryna say is the timing of the making of the movie + the making of the album couldn't be more aligned ...

replies.message: I forgot to mention the "recovery" album in my speech, must have been that Guinness I had, very very good album also... it's still def relevant to the movie Southpaw. I just think that MMLP2 was that real moment of Victory. 4 Songs off one album in the top 20 is something only the Beatles have ever accomplished ....
Of course to reach that point many other personal victories needed to be won first.
Eminem is so amazing and sooo is justin dalling :D https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N0bCMWO7abI&list=PLlkrGo3AGGNEv1WyNV0NohJytsvWEgkzC
